blog.name: lodessa
blog.title: Not a Smut Queen... A Smut Khaleesi
blog.description:
I appear to have tumbled back down into Game of Thrones/A Song of Ice and Fire Fandom again (Jaime/Brienne, Dany/Jorah, Jon/Sansa, amongst other pairings). I'm still living that Star Trek Fan Life (mostly Voyager [Janeway/Chakotay OTP) and Discovery (Admiral Katrina Cornwell and Captain Philippa Georgiou focus). I cannot possibly list everything I might reblog, but forever carrying a torch for Veronica Mars (I live a Weevil appreciation life), Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries, Doctor Who (Nine, Martha Jones), Roslin/Adama, Buffy/Faith, Aral/Cordelia, amongst others.


Testimonial by wakeupgreat:

"lodessa is an amazing human! she can be recognized in the wild by her inara icon and is known across the land for star trek rpf and for being into a song of ice and fire long before it was a tv show. she is a fellow fandom oldie and we relate on many levels. also once she wrote me cersei/brienne so basically she is the BEST."

summary: A Clawing of Longing - lodessa - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
title: A Clawing of Longing - lodessa - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 3/3
Fandom: Game of Thrones (TV)
Rating: Explicit
Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
Relationships: Jon Snow/Sansa Stark
Characters: Sansa Stark, Jon Snow, Brienne of Tarth, Daenerys Targaryen, Tyrion Lannister, Jorah Mormont, Jaime Lannister, Robert “Sweetrobin” Arryn
Additional Tags: Fix-It, AU From the End of 8x03, Jorah Mormont Lives, Happy Ending, Background Relationships, Background Jaime/Brienne, Implied Background Dany/Jorah, Alternate Universe - Canon Divergence, Explicit Sexual Content, First Time, Mild References to Sansa’s History of Trauma, very mild, references to past relationships, Jealousy, Love Confessions, Forbidden Love, Rumors, Resolved Sexual Tension
Series: Part 3 of Game of Fixes
Summary: Sansa and Jon both find themselves reevaluating their interactions with Daenerys, and realizing that perhaps they are more about their feelings for one another than about the queen. Is there a chance for them to make it right, or is duty really the death of love?

Additional Notes: So it’s finally done.  Three fixes for three ships after the abomination that was the latter half of Season 8.  Much love to @goodqueenalys for helping me come up with the solution to the corner I’d written myself into.

blog.name: bighoundlittlebird
blog.title: BigHoundLittleBird
blog.description: The Sansan Safe Haven, in case the other blog gets deleted

summary:
The Great Escape by Pojypojy
The Great Escape Close up by Pojypojy
"I could keep you safe," he rasped. "They're all afraid of...
body:
The Great Escape by Pojypojy

The Great Escape Close up by Pojypojy

“I could keep you safe,” he rasped. “They’re all afraid of me. No one would hurt you again, or I’d kill them.” He yanked her closer, and for a moment she thought he meant to kiss her. He was too strong to fight. She closed her eyes, wanting it to be over, but nothing happened. “Still can’t bear to look, can you?” she heard him say.

blog.name: lotsoffandomimagines
blog.title: ✎ Just Imagine It ✎
blog.description:
☆ masterlist → rules → fandom list → about → fav imagines ☆
Hi! The name’s Ace. My blog runs on requests so send them in, but read my rules and fandom list before doing so! Gifs aren't mine. OC information is in my “about” link. Last but not least, this is a safe space for everyone! Be nice to each other and let your imagination soar.

summary:
Requested by anonymous 
The fight with the dead was over and finally you were reunited with Sansa. For the most part you down...
body:
Requested by anonymous

The fight with the dead was over and finally you were reunited with Sansa. For the most part you down this reunion hugging one another and whispering into each other’s ear about how grateful to see one another alive. Then when Sansa pulled away the most unexpected thing happened, Sansa lowered herself to one knee. At first you thought that she had become weak knees and fell, perhaps because all the death and loss of loved ones had finally hit her. “Sansa, are you alright?”.

“I’m alright” Sansa assured, looking up at you with the brightest smile you’ve ever seen on her face. “I’ve never been better”. Then she paused for a moment before continuing. “[Y/N] Lannister, we met years ago when my father first brought me to King’s Landing. Of course our decision to go there was followed by tragedy but it also gave me the chance to meet you. You were always so kind to me, you protected me from your cousin Joffrey when few would, and because of all of this I’m afraid I’ve fallen deeply and madly in love with you”.

You opened your mouth to respond to this, perhaps to assure her that you loved her as well but you were finding it difficult to speak. In fact the only thing you managed to let out was her name. “Sansa…”.

“Keep in mind part of the reason that I’m doing this is because your father simply wouldn’t leave me alone unless I at least attempted to do so” Sansa chuckled at the thought of your father Tyrion. “But if your witness is decline my request then I will not hold it against you but [Y/N]… will you marry me”.

“I-I” You stammered for a moment. This was all so surreal, simply because you’ve dreamed of this happening ever since you first laid eyes on Sansa. Unfortunately now that it was happening you couldn’t force your foolish self to answer right away. Eventually you did regain the strength to speak and you gave her your reply with an intense amount of joy. “Of course I’ll marry you Sansa. Of course”.

REQUESTS ARE OPEN

So when you hear my voice
When you say my name
May it never give you pain.
I don't wanna go
But it's time to leave
You'll be on...
body:
~Blackwater modern AU aesthetic~

So when you hear my voice

When you say my name

May it never give you pain.

I don’t wanna go

But it’s time to leave

You’ll be on my mind, my destiny.

summary: Who do you ship Sansa with?
question: Who do you ship Sansa with?
answer:
I have one key one:

Sansa x happiness


All I have ever wanted for Sansa (both in the books and the show) was for her to be safe, happy and surrounded by people who actually love and respect her.

tags: adventures of ser mom and ser dad and their dumbass northern kids
summary:
Sansa, on the phone: Mumma, we got a problem. 
Brienne: Oh no. 
*Arya snatching the phone from Sansa*
Arya: Before you get mad...
body:
Sansa, on the phone: Mumma, we got a problem.

Brienne: Oh no.

*Arya snatching the phone from Sansa*

Arya: Before you get mad just remember, with great boredom comes great irresponsibility.

Brienne: Please tell me you didn’t put Bran on the roof again.

Bran in the background: *distant cawing sounds*

Arya: He likes to pretend he’s a bird. You know this.

Brienne: WHERE IS YOUR FATHER?!

Jaime in the background: Hey guys! I bet you won’t dare me to backflip off this roof!

Brienne: I’m coming home. Go ahead and call 911 when we hang up.

Brienne: I’m coming home. Go ahead and call 911 when we hang up.

summary: I just watched Troy again and found that Achilles with Briseis kind of reminds me of Sandor and Sansa. I mean a big guy with...
body:
I just watched Troy again and found that Achilles with Briseis kind of reminds me of Sandor and Sansa. I mean a big guy with great battle skills and a really young girl who prays to the gods and is a virgin and those moments when he’s protecting her and saves her from rape and other stuff… anyone else having this feeling?

So… some au oneshot? Have you got any ideas? Maybe Jon as Paris, stealing Dany as Helen… or Rickon and Myrcella as Paris and Helen… And Robb as big protective brother Hector… idk send me everything you think of.

summary: So winterfell had bran who liked to climb stuff to dangerous heights for no apparent reason, Arya being a feisty little girl and...
body:
So winterfell had bran who liked to climb stuff to dangerous heights for no apparent reason, Arya being a feisty little girl and also fighting with Sansa a lot including stuffing her mattress full of sheep shit, Jon just brooding all over the place, plus Robb, Theon, and rickon to contend with…

Props to catelyn and Ned for getting (most of) them to at least adulthood alive

summary: me: the last two seasons of game of thrones were awful and I hated them but I’m over it now, it is what it is, moving on moving...
body:
me: the last two seasons of game of thrones were awful and I hated them but I’m over it now, it is what it is, moving on moving on

also me the moment the winterfell theme starts playing: I HAVE NEVER BEEN THIS UPSET IN MY LIFE!!!! MY CHILDREN DESERVED SO MUCH BETTER,,,,BABIES,,,,I’M SO SORRY THEY DID THAT

blog.name: ashleyfanfic
blog.title: Musings and Loves
blog.description:
Ashley | Too old to probably be here and be respectable | I have ships I will sail forever | Pacey x Joey | Remy x Rogue | Jon x Daenerys | Draco x Hermione | 30 Seconds to Mars | Music | Loves Food | Loves Beaches | Loves laughing | Back is totally fucked up forever | If you're my friend, I will fight for you no matter what | I will listen to a song so much that I actually get tired of hearing it but will continue listening to it until I want to harm someone for making me listen to it | I have anxiety about having to go do things but then get over it once I'm there | Panic attacks are Real | Depression is real | But I try to be positive here |

Header is taken from @jon-erys

summary: Jaime/Sansa - 16
question: Jaime/Sansa - 16
answer:
16. things you said with no space between us

I would consider this a missing scene from Love on the Brain. I mean, it could def be between their wedding and the final scene of the last chapter. 

find the list of prompts here:

*~*

She pressed her hands into his chest, to hold herself up as wave after wave crashed into her. This isn’t what she had expected when she’d come into his study to ask him if he wanted to join her for lunch. The intensity of the look he gave her as he crossed the room to where she was standing and closed the door behind her caused her to press her thighs together to keep away the ache for him. She wanted some quality time with her husband. She hadn’t expected him to practically pull her to the sofa to ravish her. 

She lowered herself to his chest and his arms wrapped around her, holding her tight. Their breathing was labored and she shivered a bit but wasn’t cold in the least. He was still buried inside her, his fingers trailing through her soft hair. The intimacy of the moment was beautiful and she smiled against his neck. “I love you, Jaime.”

“Good. I love you, too,” he said as he lifted her head and kissed her. She looked up and kissed him again, conveying to her in more than words how he felt for her. With every kiss, it was as if they were exposing themselves more and more to each other. Able to convey without words what they meant to one another, how they felt. It was easier than saying the words, at times. When he broke the kiss, he stroked his fingers over her cheek and let his thumb slowly glide over her bottom lip. His green eyes shone back at her and she could feel the happiness and contentment in them. She buried her face in his neck and clung to him. 

“We’re going to stay and do only this the rest of the day, right?” she asked finally and she was rewarded with a dark chuckle. 

“Whatever my lady wants.”

blog.name: secretlyatargaryen
blog.title: Worms are crawling in and out of Rhaegar's ass
blog.description: Jenny. This blog consists mainly of Game of Thrones/A Song of Ice and Fire, with particular focus on Tyrion, but also among my favorites are Sansa, Cersei, Arya, and Brienne. I also occasionally post about video games or books or whatever else I find interesting.

summary: I was browsing some of your asoiaf, and was curious about something you said about Cat and Sansa being the favorite children. I...
question: I was browsing some of your asoiaf, and was curious about something you said about Cat and Sansa being the favorite children. I can understand why you would think Cat was her dad's favorite, but I'm confused about Sansa's inclusion. Why do you think Sansa is Ned or even Cat's favorite child? To me, Sansa is the easy child. It's like that old saying: "The squeaky wheel gets the oil". She met their expectations,so they left her alone. They had other more rebellious children to worry about.
answer:
I kinda had a feeling I would get a comment about this because I know there’s Discourse over the idea that Sansa didn’t get enough attention from her parents or was treated unfairly in favor of Arya, and I think that comes from Sansa’s own feelings of jealousy over Arya getting attention and her anxiety about being the perfect child. But that is very much a “favored child” thing, needing to be the favored child all the time. I think she was the easy child and she was often praised for that and expected to be that. She’s also the firstborn girl in her family, which makes her special in the eyes of her parents and adds an additional need that she fit the social expectations of a girl, and since she excelled at that she was favored in that respect. That doesn’t mean I think she necessarily got more attention than any of the others, and I mean, it’s not a competition so Idk why some people are trying to make it one where Sansa is Most Neglected or something. I compared her to Catelyn thinking that her father loved her best because she always did her duty, because Sansa WAS favored in that respect, and I think Sansa had the same mindset, that if she always did what she was supposed to then her parents would love her the best, which had the side effect of creating a complex where she always NEEDED to live up to other people’s expectations, and both Catelyn and Sansa have that problem. They are also both the eldest girl in their family so I think that added to the conception that they needed to be special.

I think she was favored in some ways and neglected in others and I think that does do damage that is reflected in her pov. And, I mean, this is how patriarchy works, it’s a double-edged sword where women are cut no matter what they do. But Arya was the same way, although in different ways. Both of them suffered from the way society treats girls. Sansa was favored and praised for her ability to conform to societal expectations:

“Sansa was a lady at three, always so courteous and eager to please. She loved nothing so well as tales of knightly valor. Men would say she had my look, but she will grow into a woman far more beautiful than I ever was, you can see that. I often sent away her maid so I could brush her hair myself. She had auburn hair, lighter than mine, and so thick and soft … the red in it would catch the light of the torches and shine like copper.”

This quote shows that not only was Sansa praised for being beautiful and ladylike, but she received special personal attention from her parents because of it. Which is precisely why Sansa gets jealous when Arya receives attention despite and sometimes because of not living up to expectations. I think Sansa had higher expectations placed on her and so she would be held to a higher expectation, which is why she gets upset when Ned praises Arya for picking wildflowers and getting dirty, for instance, something that if Sansa did, she would probably be scolded for.

We also know from both Cat and Ned and Arya and Sansa’s pov that Sansa was held up as the example for Arya to live up to many times, by her parents and by Septa Mordane. They may have left Sansa alone in terms of disciplining or teaching her because they didn’t need to, she’s the good child and she would always do what was expected of her, but she was also constantly expected to be an example, which puts pressure both on Arya and on Sansa to live up to that expectation.

I get annoyed with this sort of discourse because not only is it just another aspect of Ye Olden Arya vs Sansa Fandom War, but there seems to be this conception that if, like Sansa, girls and women do everything right and are the perfect image of femininity, there’s a way to win against the patriarchy, and it’s other people who are at fault for not appreciating Sansa’s perfectness, or whatever. You can’t win by playing their game, though. Patriarchy is set up for women to fail no matter what they do, which is why neither Arya nor Sansa won the “perfect daughter” contest, and why both ended up feeling like the other did at times.

That doesn’t mean I think she necessarily got more attention than any of the others, and I mean, it’s not a competition so Idk why some people are trying to make it one where Sansa is Most Neglected or something. I compared her to Catelyn thinking that her father loved her best because she always did her duty, because Sansa WAS favored in that respect, and I think Sansa had the same mindset, that if she always did what she was supposed to then her parents would love her the best, which had the side effect of creating a complex where she always NEEDED to live up to other people’s expectations, and both Catelyn and Sansa have that problem. They are also both the eldest girl in their family so I think that added to the conception that they needed to be special.

I think she was favored in some ways and neglected in others and I think that does do damage that is reflected in her pov. And, I mean, this is how patriarchy works, it’s a double-edged sword where women are cut no matter what they do. But Arya was the same way, although in different ways. Both of them suffered from the way society treats girls. Sansa was favored and praised for her ability to conform to societal expectations:

“Sansa was a lady at three, always so courteous and eager to please. She loved nothing so well as tales of knightly valor. Men would say she had my look, but she will grow into a woman far more beautiful than I ever was, you can see that. I often sent away her maid so I could brush her hair myself. She had auburn hair, lighter than mine, and so thick and soft … the red in it would catch the light of the torches and shine like copper.”

This quote shows that not only was Sansa praised for being beautiful and ladylike, but she received special personal attention from her parents because of it. Which is precisely why Sansa gets jealous when Arya receives attention despite and sometimes because of not living up to expectations. I think Sansa had higher expectations placed on her and so she would be held to a higher expectation, which is why she gets upset when Ned praises Arya for picking wildflowers and getting dirty, for instance, something that if Sansa did, she would probably be scolded for.

We also know from both Cat and Ned and Arya and Sansa’s pov that Sansa was held up as the example for Arya to live up to many times, by her parents and by Septa Mordane. They may have left Sansa alone in terms of disciplining or teaching her because they didn’t need to, she’s the good child and she would always do what was expected of her, but she was also constantly expected to be an example, which puts pressure both on Arya and on Sansa to live up to that expectation.

I get annoyed with this sort of discourse because not only is it just another aspect of Ye Olden Arya vs Sansa Fandom War, but there seems to be this conception that if, like Sansa, girls and women do everything right and are the perfect image of femininity, there’s a way to win against the patriarchy, and it’s other people who are at fault for not appreciating Sansa’s perfectness, or whatever. You can’t win by playing their game, though. Patriarchy is set up for women to fail no matter what they do, which is why neither Arya nor Sansa won the “perfect daughter” contest, and why both ended up feeling like the other did at times.
trail.content:
I kinda had a feeling I would get a comment about this because I know there’s Discourse over the idea that Sansa didn’t get enough attention from her parents or was treated unfairly in favor of Arya, and I think that comes from Sansa’s own feelings of jealousy over Arya getting attention and her anxiety about being the perfect child. But that is very much a “favored child” thing, needing to be the favored child all the time. I think she was the easy child and she was often praised for that and expected to be that. She’s also the firstborn girl in her family, which makes her special in the eyes of her parents and adds an additional need that she fit the social expectations of a girl, and since she excelled at that she was favored in that respect. That doesn’t mean I think she necessarily got more attention than any of the others, and I mean, it’s not a competition so Idk why some people are trying to make it one where Sansa is Most Neglected or something. I compared her to Catelyn thinking that her father loved her best because she always did her duty, because Sansa WAS favored in that respect, and I think Sansa had the same mindset, that if she always did what she was supposed to then her parents would love her the best, which had the side effect of creating a complex where she always NEEDED to live up to other people’s expectations, and both Catelyn and Sansa have that problem. They are also both the eldest girl in their family so I think that added to the conception that they needed to be special.

I think she was favored in some ways and neglected in others and I think that does do damage that is reflected in her pov. And, I mean, this is how patriarchy works, it’s a double-edged sword where women are cut no matter what they do. But Arya was the same way, although in different ways. Both of them suffered from the way society treats girls. Sansa was favored and praised for her ability to conform to societal expectations:

“Sansa was a lady at three, always so courteous and eager to please. She loved nothing so well as tales of knightly valor. Men would say she had my look, but she will grow into a woman far more beautiful than I ever was, you can see that. I often sent away her maid so I could brush her hair myself. She had auburn hair, lighter than mine, and so thick and soft … the red in it would catch the light of the torches and shine like copper.”

This quote shows that not only was Sansa praised for being beautiful and ladylike, but she received special personal attention from her parents because of it. Which is precisely why Sansa gets jealous when Arya receives attention despite and sometimes because of not living up to expectations. I think Sansa had higher expectations placed on her and so she would be held to a higher expectation, which is why she gets upset when Ned praises Arya for picking wildflowers and getting dirty, for instance, something that if Sansa did, she would probably be scolded for.

We also know from both Cat and Ned and Arya and Sansa’s pov that Sansa was held up as the example for Arya to live up to many times, by her parents and by Septa Mordane. They may have left Sansa alone in terms of disciplining or teaching her because they didn’t need to, she’s the good child and she would always do what was expected of her, but she was also constantly expected to be an example, which puts pressure both on Arya and on Sansa to live up to that expectation.

I get annoyed with this sort of discourse because not only is it just another aspect of Ye Olden Arya vs Sansa Fandom War, but there seems to be this conception that if, like Sansa, girls and women do everything right and are the perfect image of femininity, there’s a way to win against the patriarchy, and it’s other people who are at fault for not appreciating Sansa’s perfectness, or whatever. You can’t win by playing their game, though. Patriarchy is set up for women to fail no matter what they do, which is why neither Arya nor Sansa won the “perfect daughter” contest, and why both ended up feeling like the other did at times.
